abstract.t: Automatic IP Multicast Tunneling (AMT) allows multicast reception by isolated multicast-enabled sites or hosts, attached to a network which has no native multicast support. It enables them to receive multicast traffic from the native multicast infrastructure without requiring any manual configuration. AMT uses an encapsulation interface so that no changes to a host stack or applications are required, all protocols (not just UDP) are handled, and there is no additional overhead in core routers.
